programme.title: Wildest Islands: Japan: Islands of Extremes
programme.desc: Japan's 7,000 islands stretch for over 2,400 km, and cover an incredible range of climates. Winter in the central and northern islands can be savage, but summer in the sweltering southern islands couldn't be more different.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Nile: An African Odyssey
programme.desc: The Nile is the longest river in the world. Ancient Egypt, one of the history's most powerful civilizations, depended hugely upon it. Each year, it flooded, replenishing the fields with fertile silt. This automatic irrigation fueled Egypt's economy.

programme.title: Wildest India: Thar Desert: Sacred Sands
programme.desc: Covering 200,000 km sq, India's Thar desert is one of the harshest places on Earth. Desiccating winds and near permanent drought has earned this unforgiving land another name: the region of death.

programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Venezuela: The Treasure of El Dorado
programme.desc: Venezuela is famous for its lost worlds, its forbidding mountains, huge swamps, and impenetrable jungles, all seemingly cut off in space and time. Yet each is linked, by the mighty river: the Orinoco, the rumoured route to El Dorado, city of gold.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Galapagos: Darwin's Eden
programme.desc: The Galapagos archipelago contains 13 main islands and a hundred or so smaller rocks and reefs. The region's wilderness is so pristine and rich in life. / Lying like a teardrop in the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka is an island that defies convention.

programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay puts two teams of aspiring chefs through a series of tough challenges. The teams meet new members before heading into a team challenge in which they must prepare a tasting menu for a dog show.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The teams roll the dice to determine the ingredients for their next team challenge, while a contestant leaves due to an injury. The cooks cater for music legends during dinner service, including Stewart Copeland and Steven Tyler.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Following the departure of two contestants from the competition, those remaining are challenged to create Indian-inspired meals, with the winning team earning a day of pampering at a luxurious spa.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay puts aspiring chefs through tough challenges. The teams are challenged to a blind taste test. Dinner service is held in honour of a group of decorated firefighters.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: In the season finale, Ian tries to bring it all together.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian and his most ambitious client break all the rules and build the ultimate boat-inspired, open-aired cruiser. (Part 1)

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian and his most ambitious client continue the ultimate open-aired cruiser build and debut it a top West Coast car show. (Part 2)

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian gets a call from a top Hollywood picture car coordinator and works his magic to get a vintage race car back in action.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Ian is commissioned to help build a wild, massive mobile floating party island for a prestigious festival in the Nevada desert (Burning Man).

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: A new client comes into the picture with a vintage desire; a hand-built motorcycle in the vein of early Harley Davidson’s, but with a Full Custom twist. And later, Ian pushes the envelope with a cool electric bike build for himself.

programme.title: Andromeda: Chaos and the Stillness of It
programme.desc: Dylan, Rhade and Beka work together to rescue Trance from Methus-2 and Harper from General Burma.

programme.title: Andromeda: The Heart of the Journey (Part 1)
programme.desc: The crew finally makes it out of the Seefra system and discovers Dylan is the last Paradine.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: The final battle to save the New Systems Commonwealth begins.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: After being left stranded near a black hole, Captain Dylan Hunt is discovered by a mercenary salvage ship and finds he has been frozen in time for 300 years.

programme.title: Andromeda: An Affirming Flame
programme.desc: Dylan protects the Andromeda from mercenaries while Beka starts to wonder if they are fighting for the wrong side.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Dylan finds a space station full of kids who believe he is there to bring peace by killing their enemies.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: The Patient Killer
programme.desc: In 1976, thirteen-year-old schoolgirl Tracey Ann Patient was plucked off Auckland's Great North Road. The following morning, her body was found dumped 16 km away in the Waitakere Ranges, having been strangled with a pantyhose tourniquet.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Out of the Dark
programme.desc: Described as a brutal execution, 46-year-old grandmother Chattrice Maihi-Carroll was found naked, stabbed to death in her New Zealand home in 2008. There were multiple suspects and everything seemed resolved following the arrest of a neighbour.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Where There's Smoke
programme.desc: In 2006, 19-year-old Blake Stott died in a mysterious car fire. Blake had seemingly pulled into a South Otago lay-by to have a sleep, when his late-model, un-modified car burst into flames.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Vanishing Point
programme.desc: In 2003, 32-year-old mother of three Sara Neithe vanished from the Hauraki Plains. Neither Sara nor her car have been seen since. Police suspect that Sara has been murdered but without a crime scene, they have been unable to advance the case.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost Soul
programme.desc: In 1985, 25-year-old Luana 'La Verne' Williams disappeared from her Tauranga home. Eight years later her disappearance was upgraged to a murder enquiry. Her body has never been found.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Gonzales Family Murders
programme.desc: On July 10, 2001, Sef Gonzales murdered his sister Clodine, 18, mother Mary Loiva Josephine, 43, and his father Teddy, 46, in their North Ryde home.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Snowtown: Bodies in the Barrels
programme.desc: In 1999, eight bodies are found in six barrels filled with acid in a former bank vault in rural Snowtown, 50 kilometres north of Adelaide.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Butchered Boys
programme.desc: This episode revisits Adelaide's notorious Adelaide Family Murders case, where six young Adelaide men were murdered during the 1970s and '80s. The victims were found in random locations throughout the state, their bodies neatly cut into pieces.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Cop Killer: The Winchester Assassination
programme.desc: The highest ranking police officer in Australia to be murdered, Assistant Federal Police Commissioner Colin Winchester was shot twice in the head at point blank range as he was getting out of his car outside his Deakin home on 10 January 1989.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Stevie’s daughter Rose (Basia A’hern) turns up at Drovers unexpectedly. She’s run away from her Mum to live with her Aunty Stevie.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: The weekend of Stevie and Alex’s rodeo school has finally arrived and they are excited with the prospect of turning their fresh faced students into rodeo stars.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: A minor car accident at the truckstop brings Stevie and Kane Morgan (Craig McLachlan) together for the first time. Stevie, at fault, is smitten by this handsome stranger when he tells her not to worry about the damage to his car.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: On a stiflingly hot summer morning, Tess bakes a batch of bread using organic rye flour she bought from one of the members of her organics group. It’s also her Saturn birthday and she laments to Stevie that she hasn’t achieved any of her goals.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Kane’s relationship with Stevie and Alex strains their friendship.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: The course of true love never runs smooth – or at least, it doesn’t for Tess. Madly in love with Nick, she’s decided to turn traditional courtship on its head and ask him to marry her, but it’s easier said than done.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Fortress of Phantoms
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS heads tothe historic Fort Adams in Newport, Rhode Island. The teams investigate three deadly eventsthat surprisingly weren't from battle!

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Houghton Hears A Who?
programme.desc: TAPS investigates Houghton Mansionin North Adams, Massachusetts where the repercussions of a deadly car accident could be behind unexplained phenomena on the property.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Darker Learning
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS has been called to investigate Southern Vermont College in Bennington, Vermont. The legend of a mysterious love triangleand suicidescould be at the root of frightening paranormal activity.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Innocent Until Proven Dead
programme.desc: TAPS has been called to Louisville, Kentucky to help three descendants find out if their ancestors arestill inhabitingthe property they owned in the 1800's.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Rockets Red Scare
programme.desc: TAPS travels back in time, to the 1700's to investigate the renowned USS Constitution, \\"Old Ironsides\\", which is docked in Boston, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: 1st Edition Apparition
programme.desc: TAPS is revisiting Edith Wharton's home, The Mount, in Lenox, Massachusetts. It's believed Edith andher husband could be behind increased activity since the team's last investigation in 2008.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back in the Hood
programme.desc: Today, Dog's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills to track his prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: One for the Road
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out. He's also giving his nephew Justin a second chance to rejoin the team.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bait and Switch
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting. When the fugitive's girlfriend offers to help Dog trap this dangerous felon, Dog knows that someone is being deceived. The only question is, whom?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: True Identity
programme.desc: Dog knows that looks can be deceiving. The fugitive is pretty, petite, and trouble. She stands accused of settling an argument with the help of a box cutter. What Dog does not anticipate is how deceptive this femme fatale can truly be!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Secrets and Lies
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call your good friend Dog.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Match Point
programme.desc: Duty calls and the Chapmans are off on a hunt. The team chases a fugitive who has disappeared into a world of "no known addresses."

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Menehune Mischief
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits - Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers - the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mister Mom
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon, Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Sadie's Choice
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Children of the Cornbread
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si, it ends up being Si who has the last laugh.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Whole Lotta Bull
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Comes the Son
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bro'd Trip
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought. There's a lice outbreak at Duck Command.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The West Monroe Wing
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Automation Frustration
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si is upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Razing the Snakes
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Uneasy Rider
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead. Jase and the guys are inspired to design a product using zip lines that will revolutionize duck hunting.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Willie Hunting
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Thief Who Stole Christmas
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Rock-a-Bye Bounty
programme.desc: Dog and Beth must go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family. Luckily, Beth's nephew, Jason, is visiting and is quickly put to work as the bait.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Father-Hood
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Cops and Criminals
programme.desc: After giving a rousing speech to an audience of enthusiastic grade-schoolers, Dog catches up with an old friend, Sheriff Tommy Cayetano, to talk business. Dog's got a tough fugitive, named Mia, to catch and Tommy is happy to lend a hand.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Cupid in Cuffs
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bonds of Love
programme.desc: Dog and Beth are finally getting married! They've been together for more than ten years but Dog is determined, as he puts it, to "marry his common law wife the Christian way."

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: To Love and to Cherish
programme.desc: Dog and Beth are off to the Big Island for their wedding. They hope to relax for a few days but it turns out Leland has a fugitive he needs to catch and despite the time limit, neither Dog nor Beth can resist the opportunity to catch a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bustin' with Justin
programme.desc: Dog and the team must deal with misleading informants, belligerent boaters, and angry drunks when they go after Kimberly, a traffic offender with over 20 violations. And if that isn't enough, Dog has another problem - Duane Lee is sick.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Run Fugitive, Run
programme.desc: When the team hunts for Steven, a fugitive with a history of domestic abuse, they seek help from his girlfriend, who's been a victim of his abuse. Meanwhile, Beth trains for a 5K race to help raise awareness about domestic abuse.

programme.title: NEW Half & Half: The Big Who's Wooing Who? Episode
programme.desc: When Mona is courted and gets a job offer from another record label, she has to make a choice between staying at Delicious Records or moving on. Meanwhile, in order to keep up with the Jones’, Big Dee Dee plans an extravagant birthday party for Drew.

programme.title: NEW Half & Half: The Big Thorne In My Side Episode
programme.desc: When Phyllis gets into trouble with her Homeowner's Association, Dee Dee comes to her defense, but ends up causing more harm than good.

programme.title: NEW Half & Half: The Big Pomp And Circumstance Episode
programme.desc: Dee Dee starts to feel the pressure as her law school graduation fast approaches and she hasn't landed a job. Meanwhile, Mona panics when Phyllis finds a terrific apartment in her neighborhood.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Where Did Lynn-Digo?
programme.desc: When Lynn meets Xander, a cute student at UCLA, he asks her to perform at a rally raising awareness to save the environment. But when Lynn's manager gets her a gig at the House of Blues for the same day, she must decide where she will perform.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Losing It
programme.desc: Maya tries to avoid calls from her publisher when she experiences writer's block and is unable to complete her third book.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Good Grief
programme.desc: When Maya accuses Darnell of blaming her for the miscarriage, Joan and Lynn are worried that Maya is in denial and not allowing herself to grieve.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Spree to Free
programme.desc: Joan is convinced that Maya is not coping with the recent loss of her baby, and decides a little retail therapy will help her recover.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Snap Back
programme.desc: At a gathering to celebrate William and Monica's pregnancy, Maya makes a joke that the baby is hers. Worried that Maya is having trouble dealing with the loss of their baby, Darnell confronts Maya and learns that she has been taking pills to help her cope

programme.title: Girlfriends: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: Lynn calls Joan, Maya, and William old after realizing they never go out anymore. They decide to prove Lynn wrong by joining her for a night on the town at a hot new club.

programme.title: Girlfriends: R-E-S-P-E-C-T, Find Out What It Means to William
programme.desc: When William begins to feel that he is not respected at work he considers leaving the firm, and Monica freaks out thinking that he won’t be able to support her and their new baby.

programme.title: NEW The Parkers: And the Winner Is…
programme.desc: A talent contest pits Kim, T and Stevie against each other.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Hostage to Fear
programme.desc: P.R.S. is summoned to help a family who has been haunted for years by spirits lurking in the house. Upon arrival the team finds a family that has become prisoners in their own home.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Basement
programme.desc: A history of violence may connect the spiritual activity in Heidi's Ohio home to a long run of misery and cruelty.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Desperate Households
programme.desc: When Julie and her family moved into their dream home in suburban New Jersey they quickly realized they were not alone.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Satan's Soldier
programme.desc: Mark and Kim can't sleep through the racket caused by unseen forces in their central Indiana home. When PRS and Psychic/Medium Michelle Belanger discover what appears to be blood in the basement, they investigate a history of violence in the home.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Boy Pushed Me
programme.desc: Bruce and Danielle are terrified by an EVP recorded in their Indiana home stating "Kill them." Even more chilling, their toddler son survived a fall out of a window only to tell his parents, "Boy pushed me."

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Name
programme.desc: Ryan Buell and company set out on one of their most dangerous cases to date - to help a single mother who is experiencing paranormal activity in a home that was once the site of brutal murder.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Fury
programme.desc: Kathy, her two daughters and her new husband, "Farmer" thought they had the perfect, quiet life deep in the mountains of West Virginia.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Return of the Dead: Glove II
programme.desc: PRS returns to the site of one of their most famous cases, Daisytown, PA, where they had discovered a glove print of an old miner that they determined was the spirit of a Great-Grandfather.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Southern Discomfort At Sweetwater Mansion
programme.desc: PRS heads to the Deep South to investigate a haunted Antebellum Mansion in disrepair. The caretaker and volunteers at the property have many a tale to tell of paranormal activity.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Ladder
programme.desc: A large family in Shrewsbury, MA, has been living with a spirit for the last 40 years. To most of the siblings, the entity is menacing and evil, but Sandy seems to have a different connection.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Dark Practice
programme.desc: Brenda is terrified by a dark hooded figure spotted in her West Virginia home. The same entity allegedly tormented her late husband. PRS and Psychic/Medium Michelle Belanger help Brenda before she slips into the same abyss as her late husband.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Wentworth Woodhouse Part 1
programme.desc: Part 1. The upper floors of Wentworth House are a maze of corridors and rooms and the team have one night to investigate as many as possible. With one whistling spirit, groans and loud noises the team are shaken to their core.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Wentworth Woodhouse Part 2
programme.desc: Part 2. The underbelly of this great house is a sharp contrast to its upper grandeur. Some members of the team are forced to run while other are lost in the labyrinth of tunnels and passageways pursued by something unnatural.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Oakwell House
programme.desc: The team investigate Oakwell House near Leeds, which was built by ancestors of Fred Batt. In 1684, William Batt returned unexpectedly from a trip to London but vanished leaving a bloody footprint. A demon dog has been seen in the grounds.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Knottingley Town Hall
programme.desc: This location is said to be overflowing with paranormal activity, which doesn’t disappoint.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Capesthorne Hall
programme.desc: The beauty of this magnificent Cheshire country house hides the horror that lies in its corridors. As well a poltergeist activity the team manage to catch some of their best evidence to date and even our sceptic hears noises.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Close Encounters of the Heavenly Kind
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help a bullied orphan whose eccentric grandfather is in danger of losing him to a heartless social worker.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Change of Life
programme.desc: Mark switches places with an attractive movie star who has a low opinion of men.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Keep Smiling
programme.desc: Jonathan must help his own widow regain her love for life.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: The Last Assignment
programme.desc: An errant angel has been on probation for two centuries because he's always breaking the rules.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: The Bind the Wounds
programme.desc: A father attempts to have a memorial made to commemorate his son who was killed in Vietnam.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 3
programme.desc: It is Danny's first day as State Vet and when he helps rescue some smuggled animals he feels he's making a difference. However, he discovers the role isn't going to be all plain sailing.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 4
programme.desc: Danny's first big project as State Vet is a major animal translocation, and he is desperate to impress. Meanwhile, whilst Alice is out in the bush treating an injured zebra, she is stalked by lions. She makes it back to her jeep in time but is shaken up.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 5
programme.desc: Alice is still suffering from a loss of nerve after her close shave with the lions and so Danny tries to help her overcome her problems – the Leopard's Den lions have produced their first cub and he needs Alice back in the saddle.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 6
programme.desc: In his role as State Vet, Danny works with wealthy conservationist, Anton Ziegler, to catch a group of leopard hunters. Ziegler is also buying a tiger from Vanessa, who struggling with her finances, desperately needs the money to ensure Mara's future.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 7
programme.desc: Du Plessis has started a one man campaign of vandalism against the new neighbours at Mara; Peeters and the mining company. When Peeters catches him on CCTV, Du Plessis is fined and given a restraining order to keep him away from Mara.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 8
programme.desc: Du Plessis comes to meet Caroline's plane but he doesn't seem happy – he has seen that the mining company have already started building the road which threatens Leopard's Den.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Blood From A Stone
programme.desc: A bystander receives a deadly head injury during a roadside altercation, but the stakes are raised when his body disappears from the scene. When a toddler is kidnapped for ransom Kenda joins forces with an undercover team in a desperate race against time.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Door No. 12
programme.desc: Neighbors are stunned when close friends Louis Matos and Colleen Johnson are gunned down for no apparent reason. The case kicks into high gear when Lt Joe Kenda locates a panic-stricken eyewitness.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Knock Knock

programme.title: Sliders

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Rolf Harris

programme.title: Robbie Coltrane's Critical Evidence: Resolution To Kill: Colin Ireland

programme.title: Robbie Coltrane's Critical Evidence: The Body In The Suitcase: Lorenzo Simon
programme.desc: On 12th May 2014 a human torso was discovered in a suitcase during routine maintenance work on a Birmingham canal. With no useable DNA and no other body parts, the case initially seemed impossible to crack.

programme.title: Robbie Coltrane's Critical Evidence: Countryside Killings: Graham Backhouse
programme.desc: Robbie Coltrane examines why Graham Backhouse attempted to kill his wife with a car bomb before murdering his neighbour in 1984.

programme.title: Robbie Coltrane's Critical Evidence: Time Of Death: Albert Walker
programme.desc: When a Devonshire fisherman hauled in his nets on July 28 1996, he made a gruesome discovery: among that day’s catch was a dead body. There was nothing to identify the man’s body except a Rolex watch and a small maple leaf tattoo on his hand.

programme.title: Killer Britain: Sabrina Kouider
programme.desc: Sabrina Kouider couldn’t have lived such a glamorous lifestyle without the help of Sophie Lionnet, the young French au pair who looked after her children. What Sophie didn’t know was that her employer was gripped by frenzied delusions and paranoia.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Death Valley National Park

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Cleveland National Forest

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Apache Sitgreaves National Forests

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Great Smokey Mountains National Park
programme.desc: Great Smokey Mountains National Park: A stroll through a national park that is the alleged underground base for a powerful secret society.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Mark Twain National Forest

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Chaco Culture National Historical Park
programme.desc: Was Chaco Canyon a complex ceremonial center with extraordinary astronomical alignments of buildings and roads?

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Great Sand Dunes National Park

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Lassen Volcanic National Park

programme.title: National Park Mysteries: Crater Lake National Park
programme.desc: The tourist-attracting waters of Crater Lake National Park may also be the epicenter of dark and sinister forces from Native American lore that lure visitors to their deaths.

programme.title: Arthur: Falafelosophy/The Great Lint Rush
programme.desc: Sue Ellen tries her hand at writing and illustrating a graphic novel. Then, Mr. Toad is back! And he's ready to corner the Sock Market, leaving everyone in Elwood City barefoot and bereft.

programme.title: Arthur: Buenas Noches, Vicita/Prunella Packs It In
programme.desc: Vicita Molina has lost her favorite bedtime book – can Arthur help her re-create it? Prunella is already starting to think about college! Will she crack under the heavy load or will she learn to relax and do the things she actually enjoys?

programme.title: Arthur: All Thumbs/Kidonia
programme.desc: When Arthur catches Buster sucking his thumb, Buster worries that Arthur will tell the entire school. Tired of doing chores, Arthur and friends decide to invent their own country. Will this kid-ruled utopia flourish or descend into anarchy?

programme.title: Arthur: To Eat or Not to Eat/S.W.E.A.T.
programme.desc: A brand-new candy bar is in town! And what exactly is this ingredient called Tri-Enzomated Zorn Jelly, anyway? Then, it's time for the kids at Lakewood Elementary to take the "S.W.E.A.T” test and anxiety is running high.

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Barnes, Art Expert/Arthur's Lucky Pencil
programme.desc: It's a nightmare--Arthur and Buster have to work with Binky. On an art project! I mean, what does a bully like Binky know about art? Then, Arthur discovers the secret to success--a pencil that brings good luck to whoever possesses it.

programme.title: Arthur: Fright Night/Citizen Cheikh
programme.desc: Buster’s Uncle Bob – portrayed by special guest R.L. Stine – comes to visit and tells Buster a spooky bedtime story. Then, Cheikh learns that he and his family will become American citizens!

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Moves In/The Perfect Brother
programme.desc: A new girl has arrived in town and no one knows anything about her. And judging by the strange things happening at her house no one wants to know. Then, it's great having a friend spend the weekend.

programme.title: Arthur: Buster's Green Thumb/My Fair Tommy
programme.desc: Buster finds out that his collection of old food makes excellent compost--which makes for even better tomatoes! Then, neither of the Tibble twins has ever won the coveted "Good Behavior of the Week" cupcake award.

programme.title: Arthur: So Long, Spanky/Buster's New Friend
programme.desc: D.W.'s beloved bird gets very sick, and despite D.W.'s eager ministrations, Spanky dies. Can she risk giving her heart to another pet? Then, Buster doesn't have time for Arthur. And all he wants to talk about is a new friend named Mike.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Stalingrad
programme.desc: German forces encounter Russian resistance.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: El Alamein
programme.desc: Erwin Rommel battles Allied forces in North Africa in 1942.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: North Africa (November 1942)

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Burma: The Forgotten Front (Spring 1943)
programme.desc: The Japanese meet resistance from British forces as they advance through Burma to take India in 1944.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Sicily
programme.desc: Fresh from victory in North Africa, the Allies successfully invade the island of Sicily, staging an eventual Italian withdrawal from the war.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Bombing of Ploesti
programme.desc: American bombers target a Romanian oil refinery in a daring 1943 mission.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Monte Cassino (September 3, 1943)
programme.desc: As the allies make their way into Italy, they encounter tremendous resistance at German defensive positions along the Gustav line. One of these locations is an ancient monastery called Monte Cassino.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: The Gilbert Islands (November 1943)
programme.desc: Bloody fighting erupts on a group of tiny Pacific islands in November 1943.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Anzio
programme.desc: Allied armies encounter German resistance in the Italian fishing town of Anzio.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Kwajalein

programme.title: Catfish UK: Neil & Jasmin

programme.title: Catfish UK: Rob & Sarah
programme.desc: Oobah is joined by Nathan Henry to help Rob track down his soulmate, Sarah. After two and a half years, Sarah has suddenly gone quiet and it's up to Oobah and Nathan to investigate. (S2, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Emma & Harry

programme.desc: Esther's finally found her match in Theo. But he always refuses to video call. So it's up to Julia and Oobah to find out if Theo is who he says he is. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Cole, Abbie & The Fanpage
programme.desc: Cole and Abbie keep being sent anonymous creepy gifts to their home and their relationship is now at breaking point. Julie and Oobah head to Scotland to try and help save their marriage. (S1, ep4)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Leanne & Jamie
programme.desc: Leanne is desperate to find out if online love Jamie is her Mr Right. After cancelling on her numerous times, Leanne wants Oobah and Nella to investigate and finally bring them face to face. (S2, ep3)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Pain and Gain
programme.desc: A report about the crimes of the Sun Gym gang, a group of Miami, Florida drifters, petty thieves, and bodybuilders who kidnapped and killed wealthy people to fuel their lifestyle.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Fight For The Truth
programme.desc: 17-year-old Marty Tankleff was convicted of murdering his adoptive parents in their home. Marty initially confessed, but quickly recanted. He has fought for years for his innocence, as new witnesses have surfaced who could potentially exonerate him.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Endgame
programme.desc: Janet Levine March, a wife and mother of two young children, disappeared on August 15, 1996. In December 2004, a grand jury indicted her husband, Perry, for her murder, based on circumstantial evidence.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Brother's Mission
programme.desc: A report on the 2007 death of Karl Hoerig, a decorated military pilot from Ohio and his brother’s mission to track down and bring to justice the accused killer.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Death of a Dream
programme.desc: In 2002, dancer Catherine Woods went to New York in search of fame but became a stripper to pay the rent. She started seeing Paul Cortez while living with her ex-boyfriend David Haughn. In November 2005, she was murdered. The two men became suspects.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Family Accused
programme.desc: A report that focuses on cases where people accused of sexually abusing children were tried and imprisoned based on little real evidence other than the testimony of young children.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Elixir
programme.desc: The Impossible Missions Force offers a "fountain of youth" to the vain and dictatorial widow (guest star Ruth Roman) of the late president of a small South American country in order to depose her.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Exchange
programme.desc: Cinnamon is captured and the enemy discovers the one thing that would unmask her identity and expose the Impossible Mission Force.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bargain
programme.desc: The former dictator of a Caribbean island is made to have hallucinatory visions in which he sees his ominous destiny as part of an ingenious plot designed by the Impossible Missions Force.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Mind of Stefan Miklos
programme.desc: The Impossible Missions Force is pitted against the ingenious logic of an enemy agent (guest Steve Ihnat) as the IMF attempts to lead the agent through a maze of complicated clues in order to reach a false conclusion.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Freeze
programme.desc: Before a statute of limitations expires on a 10-million dollar robbery, the Impossible Missions Force must spring the suspect from prison and dupe him into leading police to the hiding place of the money.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A New Friend
programme.desc: While Barney has fun with his friends every day, there's something special about making a brand NEW friend! When Mr. Boyd's niece, Colleen visits the park, she's eager to make friends with the other kids...but being the "new kid" isn't easy.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Venice, Anyone?
programme.desc: Emma can't play with her friends because she has to complete a school project about her family. Before you know it, Barney brings Emma on a trip to Venice to learn more about her great granddad.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Riff is asked to be captain of a baseball team, he doesn’t think he can do it. But Barney gives him the courage to try.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Ryan tries to be just like Barney but soon learns that he is special when he's being himself! Barney explains to Baby Bop that the word "no" can help you avoid making mistakes or getting hurt.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The Park Kids decide to have a Dog Show to show off their pets. A rainy day has everyone stuck in the Caboose. Barney suggests fun activities.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Come Blow Your Horn!
programme.desc: Barney and the kids are excited because five of Mr. Boyd's brass-playing buddies are putting on a show in the park tonight! Angela is learning to play the trumpet and knows that it takes a lot of practice. BJ arrives and the group visits the caboose.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A Bird of a Different Feather
programme.desc: Barney takes the kids to Hawaii on a quest for a bird of paradise. While there, they meet some friends, learn new Hawaiian words, make a Hawaiian lei and dance a hula! Eventually, Barney and his friends find a bird of paradise.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A World of Friends
programme.desc: The children learn about many different countries while experiencing an "International Fair" on the playground.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Tea-riffic Manners

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Wild West

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ramped Up
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go head-to-head with their former assistant, Carolyn, while Ton battles a bad back. The guys discover an automatic BB gun and, when negotiations to sell a stunt ramp go south, Allen faces a tough decision.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sin City Shootout
programme.desc: 1953 Chevy-inspired bumper car; scores of M16 30-round magazines; reproduction 1940s boardwalk photobooth; aerosol-powered spud gun potato launchers.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Wreck-Shaw
programme.desc: Allen drags a starving Ton to a weekend auction and some newbie buyers try to eat up all the profit. Will a rickshaw, a wrecking ball, and blast detonators be enough to satisfy Ton's appetite, or will the guys go home hungry?

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ice, Ice, Baby
programme.desc: Ton and Allen have to get aggressive when they encounter a towering opponent with a mountain of cash. The guys uncover a vintage ice resurfacing machine and an Olympic biathlon rifle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Everything's Bigger in Texas
programme.desc: Winchester 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo; collection of 1950s electric Slot Cars.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Early Bird Special
programme.desc: Vintage Shooting Star carnival game; professional Mixed Martial Arts octagon fighting cage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Trading Places
programme.desc: When an injury sidelines Allen, he stays at the shop while Ton takes Big Sis to the auction and goes rogue, ignoring Allen's advice and making risky purchases that could lose the partners a boatload of cash.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Catch My Drift?
programme.desc: The guys land a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit that could have a one-of-a-kind pilot pistol from WWI. While trying to track down the provenance of the gun, Ton's lead foot gets them into trouble at their car sale.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: An auction in Allen's old stomping grounds triggers memories of being a "lone wolf." The guys find a set of RC race boats and when they buy a man-cave unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to some tough sales.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Reel Money
programme.desc: 1970's-era Fighting Chair used for big-game fishing; military MILES "laser tag" training system.

programme.desc: A runaway bride does some soul-searching when she’s trapped in a snowed-in cabin with her grandmother and an old flame at Christmas.

programme.desc: An assistant of an influencer and a charming vet bond to find a missy puppy before Christmas.

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob has been making secret early morning trips to the school where Mrs Percival has been giving him salsa lessons, as he wants to impress everybody at the town dance that night.

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: An observation tower is going to be added next to the Visitor’s centre to provide a scenic view of Sunflower Valley. The scaffolding is raised and Roley prepares a path to connect the tower to the Dome.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Mr and Mrs Bentley’s twenty fifth wedding anniversary and to celebrate Mr Bentley asks Bob and the gang to build a special summer house. Mrs Bentley is out for the day and the summer house is to be a surprise.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: An early morning start for the sunflower valley team, as they are moving logs in preparation for a safety fence around Mr Sabatini’s windmill. Wendy’s off to the sunflower oil factory to help Marjorie with a big delivery.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It is Wendy’s birthday, but she insists she doesn’t want any fuss – such as a surprise party. She heads off to start the day’s work, laying a Heritage Trail around the town, and Bob reveals to the Machines that he is not planning a party.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is building a new swimming pool for the Mayor. He asks Muck to collect some special tiles from JJ, explaining that they are very fragile and easy to break.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are drilling a special well at their homestead. The well has its own water tank, which needs to be raised from the ground on rocks. Wendy and Scrambler arrive for the first ever time in Sunflower Valley..

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scrambler is playing with the Sunflower Valley children; Sunny, Saffron, Carlo and Cassia in the playground. It’s the last day before they have to go back to school in Bobsville and they are all sad to be leaving.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr. Beasley decides to grow pineapples, and the best way top do this is to build a pineapple pit – a special pit, heated by horse manure! Travis wants to help and decides to fetch some horse manure from Farmer Pickles farm in Bobsville as quick as he can.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is repairing a leaking water tank at the school, when he discovers bats in the belfry. He tapes up the tank temporarily, but says the bats will need a new home as they are a protected species.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob’s just finished tidying his mobile home when Farmer Pickles comes and asks if he’ll help with his Sunflower Harvest. He needs a silo built in which to store the ripe sunflowers before they’re taken to the factory.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob’s renovating a dilapidated old watermill in Sunflower Valley – it’s going to make flour from Farmer Pickles sunflower farm. After checking that it’s safe, Bob realises that one of the millstones has gone missing. How very odd!

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a stormy night, Wendy has to mend a chimney pot at Mrs Potts’, while Bob repairs a drainage pipe for Farmer Pickles. A wire fence has been blown away at the farm too, but fixing the pipe takes priority.

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are installing a bull-rush water recycling system to clean water from Farmer Pickles’ cottage. The clean water will be used to water Farmer Pickles new orchard. Bob explains that everything needs to be built in order – it’s a process.

programme.desc: Augur is recruited by a Taelon weapons project, but the others are worried about his involvement. When the project is launched earlier than originally planned to fight a Jiridian fleet, the Earth is in danger.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Message in a Bottle
programme.desc: A Jiridian probe headed for Earth is shot down by the Taelon Embassy and crashes outside of D.C. Liam recovers the probe, but he, Augur, and Julia are captured by another underground resistance movement led by the real Colonel Liam Kincaid.

programme.title: The Lost World: London Calling
programme.desc: Nelson discovers a map that shows a way off the plateau, but he has doubts about leaving. The group has to outrun nomads as they follow the route out of the Lost Word.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Prisoner
programme.desc: A shape-shifter convinces Veronica that her parents are in a place called El Dorado. When Veronica takes off without telling the others, she unwittingly releases a powerful giant from captivity.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Games
programme.desc: Empress Centuria orders her Lizardmen to capture Tribune. When her soldiers find him at the treehouse, he, Malone, Marguerite, and Roxton are imprisoned, and thrown into the Gladiators' Arena.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Source
programme.desc: With all of Lost World thirsting for water, the explorers are attacked by raptors. They are aided by a young woman, Ana, and Marguerite becomes interested in her knowledge of the Fountain of Youth.

programme.title: The Lost World: Trophies
programme.desc: A hunting party arrives on the plateau and takes fire at a Troglodyte child. Though they claim to be there to bring them home, Veronica becomes the target of their gunfire and snares.

programme.title: The Lost World: Voodoo Queen
programme.desc: An alluring stranger named Danielle seeks aide from Roxton and the others after her village is taken by Trogs. But when the woman uses a voodoo doll to bewitch Roxton, the group must rescue her.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Eastenders veterans Pam St Clement and Rudolph Walker team up with experts Charles Hanson and James Braxton. They seek out antiques from East Sussex, Tumbridge, Wells in Kent, and finish up--dramatically--at auction at Rayleigh in Essex.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Goalkeepers Peter Shilton and Peter Schmeichel buy and sell antiques around Cheshire, aided by Paul Laidlaw and Mark Stacey. They visit a Cycling Museum in Warrington and a Football Museum in Manchester, ending up at auction in Runcorn.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Silent Witness stars Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, aided by experts James Braxton and Charlie Ross, embark on a hunt for antiques to turn a profit. From Glasgow to the Village of Kilbarchan, they end at auction in Billingshurst in West Sussex.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Masterchef's Gregg Wallace and John Torode feel the heat as they team up with experts Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross. They visit stately homes on their way from Alton in Hampshire to auction at Fernhurst on the Surrey/West Sussex border.
